020import net.tnemc.core.currency.parser.ParseMoney;
021import net.tnemc.core.currency.parser.ParseRule;
022
023import java.math.BigDecimal;
024import java.math.RoundingMode;
025import java.util.regex.Matcher;
026import java.util.regex.Pattern;
027
028/**
029 * FractionRule
030 *
031 * @author creatorfromhell
032 * @since 0.1.4.0
033 */
034public class FractionParseRule implements ParseRule {
035
036  /**
037   * Retrieves an identifier.
038   *
039   * @return The identifier as a String.
040   */
041  @Override
042  public String identifier() {
043
044    return "fraction";
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Applies the given parse money object to the input string according to the specified rules.
049   *
050   * @param parseMoney the ParseMoney object to apply the rules to
051   * @param input      the input string to apply the rules on
052   */
053  @Override
054  public String apply(final ParseMoney parseMoney, final String input) {
055    final Matcher matcher = Pattern.compile("([0-9]+)/([0-9]+)").matcher(input);
056    if(matcher.find()) {
057
058      final BigDecimal numerator = new BigDecimal(matcher.group(1));
059      final BigDecimal denominator = new BigDecimal(matcher.group(2));
060
061      if(denominator.compareTo(BigDecimal.ZERO) == 0) {
062        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Division by zero in fraction: " + input);
063      }
064
065      final BigDecimal fractionValue = numerator.divide(denominator, 10, RoundingMode.HALF_UP);
066      parseMoney.amount(fractionValue);
067
068      return input.replace(matcher.group(), fractionValue.toPlainString()).trim();
069    }
070    return input;
071  }
072}
